common.name: Name
common.noSearchResultsFirst: No search results for the first {count} items
common.duplicateGroup: Duplicate group with same field and key
common.deleteExperimentsConfirm: Deleting experiments will remove all samples in these experiments. Related traces won't be affected. This action cannot be undone. Are you sure you want to continue?

emptyState.title: Log your first trace
emptyState.description: Logging traces helps you understand the flow of your application and identify specific points in your application that may be causing issues.

actions.deleteConfirm: Deleting these traces will also remove their data from related experiment samples. This action cannot be undone. Are you sure you want to continue?

addTagDialog.maxEntitiesWarning: You can only add tags to up to {{max}} entities at a time. Please select fewer entities.

emptyState.title: Log your first thread
emptyState.description: Threads allow you to group traces together to help you evaluate your LLM model outputs in their specific context.

actions.deleteConfirm: Deleting threads will also remove all linked traces and their data. This action cannot be undone. Are you sure you want to continue?

welcomeBanner.title: Welcome to Opik ðŸ‘‹
welcomeBanner.subtitle: Opik helps you build safer, more reliable AI systems through advanced tracing, experiment management, evaluation, and real-time monitoring

overallPerformance.presentingLatest: Presenting the latest {count} projects, sorted by recent activity.

costOverview.title: Cost overview
costOverview.noDataMessage: No data found for your current filters. This may happen if there are no LLM calls in the selected time range. Try adjusting your filters to explore available data
costOverview.documentationText: Check our documentation to learn more about the cost.
costOverview.comparePeriods: Compares the total cost between the current and previous periods.

metricsOverview.integrateMessage: Integrate your project with Opik to evaluate your AI.
metricsOverview.metricsWillAppear: Metrics will appear here once data starts flowing.
metricsOverview.noMetricsProjectsMessage: Log your first project metrics to see them here
metricsOverview.noMetricsFiltersMessage: No metrics found for your current filters. This may happen if there are no traces or metrics in the selected range. Try adjusting your filters to explore available data
metricsOverview.compareMessage: Compares the average value of {metric} between the current and previous periods.
metricsOverview.documentationText: Check our documentation to learn more about the {metric}.

optimizationRuns.title: Optimization runs
optimizationRuns.noOptimizations: There are no optimization runs yet

getStarted.title: Get started
getStarted.logTraceDialogSubtitle: Select a framework and follow the instructions to integrate Comet with your code, or explore our ready-to-run examples on the right

projects.title: Projects
projects.explainerDescription: Organize your work by app, integration, or environment. Projects keep traces, metrics, and evaluations separate, making it easier to manage, monitor, and collaborate.
projects.deleteProjectsConfirm: Deleting projects will also remove all the traces and their data. This action can't be undone. Are you sure you want to continue?

explainer.description: Set up a new project to organize, isolate, and monitor different LLM workflows and apps.

dialog.title: Create a new experiment
dialog.description: Select a dataset, assign the relevant evaluators, and follow the instructions to track and compare your training runs

equals.label: Equals
equals.description: Checks if the output exactly matches the text.

levenshtein.label: Levenshtein
levenshtein.description: Calculates text similarity via edit distance.

answerRelevance.label: Answer relevance
answerRelevance.description: Evaluates how well the answer fits the question.

contextPrecision.label: Context precision
contextPrecision.description: Checks accuracy of provided context details.

charts.noChartsMessage: Please expand a group to see its chart. You can expand up to {count} deepest groups simultaneously.

explainer.description: Experiments help you evaluate and compare different LLM configurations and prompts using your datasets.

datasets.title: Datasets

dialog.explainerDescription: Create different datasets to evaluate your LLM application in different contexts, scenarios, or environments.
dialog.uploadCsvDescription: Your CSV file can contain up to 1,000 rows, for larger datasets use the SDK instead.
dialog.uploadPlaceholder: Drop a CSV file to upload or
dialog.processingMessage: This should take less than a minute. You can safely close this popup while we work.
dialog.confirmDescription: This file cannot be uploaded because it does not pass validation. If you continue, the dataset will be created without any items. You can add items manually later, or go back and upload a valid file.

datasets.deleteConfirm: Deleting these datasets will also remove all their items. Any experiments linked to them will be moved to a 'Deleted datasets' group. This action cannot be undone. Are you sure you want to continue?

explainer.description: Datasets are collections of input/output examples used to evaluate and optimize your LLM applications.

prompts.title: Prompts
prompts.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this prompt?

optimization.title: Optimization runs
optimization.noOptimizations:
There are no optimizations yet
Optimizations help improve your LLM application's performance, accuracy, and overall user experience
optimization.deleteConfirm: Deleting these optimization runs will remove all their trials and associated data. Related traces won't be affected. This action cannot be undone. Are you sure you want to continue?

dialog.title: Start an optimization run
dialog.description: Select a dataset, choose the optimizer you would like to use, and we will improve your prompt for you

fewShotOptimizer.label: Few-shot Bayesian optimizer
fewShotOptimizer.description: Optimizes prompts using few-shot learning and Bayesian optimization.

gepaOptimizer.label: GEPA optimizer
gepaOptimizer.description: Applies Genetic-Pareto search with reflection guidance.

explainer.description: Optimization runs help you systematically improve your LLM prompts and configurations using automated algorithms.

annotationQueues.title: Annotation Queues
annotationQueues.noQueues: There are no annotation queues yet
annotationQueues.deleteConfirm: Deleting these annotation queues will permanently remove all associated annotations and reviews. This action cannot be undone. Are you sure you want to continue?

dialog.name: Name
dialog.annotationGuidelinesDesc: Set how items are scored and labeled, and provide instructions so annotators give consistent feedback.
dialog.shareQueueDesc: You must invite annotators to your workspace for them to review the items. After creating the queue, you'll get a direct link to share with them.

validation.feedbackRequired: At least one feedback definition is required

emptyState.title: Organize your annotations
emptyState.description: Annotation queues let you organize traces for review and labeling, making it easy to collect feedback and improve LLM outputs.

onlineEvaluation.title: Online evaluation
onlineEvaluation.deleteRulesConfirm:
Deleting online evaluation rules will stop scoring for all new traces. Existing traces that have already been scores won't be affected. This action can't be undone. Are you sure you want to continue?

Tip: To pause scoring without deleting, disable the rules.

emptyState.title: Automate your scores
emptyState.description: An automated rule is a predefined logic that scores LLM outputs in real-time based on set criteria, ensuring efficient and consistent performance assessment.

dialog.name: Name
dialog.scopeTooltip: Choose whether the evaluation rule scores the entire thread or each individual trace. Thread-level rules assess the full conversation, while trace-level rules evaluate one model response at a time.
dialog.enableRuleDesc: Enable or disable this evaluation rule
dialog.codeMetricDisabled: This feature is not available for this environment
dialog.codeMetricCannotUpdate: Code metric cannot be updated. This feature is not available for this environment
dialog.variablesDesc: Define custom variables to reference in your prompt using mustache syntax
dialog.scoresDesc: Define what scores the model can output and map them to numerical values
dialog.filteringDesc: Apply filters to control when this rule runs
dialog.samplingRateDesc: Set the percentage of traces this rule will evaluate
dialog.scopeChangeWarning: You're about to lose your changes
dialog.scopeChangeDesc:
If you change the evaluation scope, your current rule settings â€” including prompt, model, and variable mappings â€” will be reset.
Are you sure you want to continue?
dialog.llmAsJudgeDesc: LLM-as-a-Judge uses a language model to score outputs based on custom natural language criteria like relevance, clarity, or factual accuracy.
dialog.codeMetricDesc: Code metric evaluates outputs programmatically using custom Python functions that implement specific scoring logic and return numerical results.
dialog.configureProvider: Configure a provider in settings to enable model selection
dialog.variableMappingDesc: Detected variables in your prompt (e.g., {{variable1}}) will appear below. For each one, select a field from a recent trace to map it â€” including image fields like input.image_url or output.image_base64. These mappings auto-fill the variables during rule execution.
dialog.noVariablesDesc: Add variables to your prompt using mustache syntax (e.g., {{variable_name}})

templates.customDesc: Use our template editor to write your own LLM as a Judge metric
templates.hallucinationDesc: Check if the output contains any hallucinations
templates.moderationDesc: Check if the output contains any harmful content
templates.context_recallDesc: Measures if the expected output can be attributed to the provided context
templates.context_precisionDesc: Evaluates whether the groundtruth answer is present in the provided context
templates.answer_relevanceDesc: Measures how well the output addresses the given question

dialog.imageHelper: You can add a base64 string, image URL, or template variable {{image}}
dialog.selectFieldPlaceholder: Select a key from recent trace
dialog.templateParsingError: Template parsing error. The variables cannot be extracted.
dialog.scoreDescPlaceholder: e.g. Whether the output is correct
dialog.filteringSamplingDesc: Use sampling rate to control how frequently this rule is applied. You can also add filters to select specific {scope} based on their properties. If nothing is defined, the rule will evaluate all {scope}.
dialog.filteringSamplingDescTrace: Apply filters and sampling to select which traces will be evaluated by this rule
dialog.filteringSamplingDescThread: Use sampling rate to control how frequently this rule is applied to threads

defaultScores.correctnessDesc: Whether the assistant's output effectively addresses the user's input
defaultScores.relevanceDesc: Whether the LLM response is relevant to the conversation context

feedbackDefinitions.noDefinitions: There are no feedback definitions yet
feedbackDefinitions.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete these feedback definitions?
feedbackDefinitions.explainer: Create custom fields to manually rate LLM outputs. Use them to collect structured feedback and track quality over time

dialog.name: Name
dialog.typeCategoricalDesc: Use labels (e.g. "Good", "Bad") to classify outputs qualitatively.
dialog.typeNumericalDesc: Use a numerical range (e.g. 1â€“5) to rate outputs quantitatively.

aiProviders.noProviders: There are no AI providers yet
aiProviders.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete these AI providers?

rowActions.deleteDescription: This configuration is shared across the workspace. Deleting it will remove access for everyone. This action can't be undone. Are you sure you want to proceed?

dialog.providerNameDescription: A unique identifier for this provider instance (e.g., "ollama", "vLLM", "LM-Studio").
dialog.apiKeyDescription: Custom providers may not require an API key, depending on your server setup. Learn more in the
dialog.modelsListDescription: Comma separated list of available models. Example:

explainers.whyDoINeedAnAIProvider: Connect AI providers to test prompts, preview model responses, and score traces using online evaluation rules in the Playground.
explainers.editingExistingKeyDescription: A key is already set for this provider. Since AI provider configurations are workspace-wide, adding a new key will overwrite the existing one for all users.

workspacePreferences.threadTimeoutDesc: Set the maximum time for a thread to remain active before it's automatically closed
workspacePreferences.truncationDesc: Enable or disable automatic truncation of long text content

alerts.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete these alerts?

playground.title: Playground

datasetEmptyState.title: No datasets available
datasetEmptyState.description: Create a dataset with examples to evaluate your prompt on.

playground.resetConfirmDescription: Resetting the Playground will discard all unsaved prompts. This action can't be undone. Are you sure you want to continue?
playground.experimentStoredSingle: Your run was stored in this experiment. Explore your results to find insights.
playground.experimentStoredMultiple: Your run was stored in experiments. Explore comparison results to get insights.
playground.referenceDatasetVariables: Reference dataset variables using mustache syntax: {variables}

tooltips.imageCompatibility: Some prompts contain images but the selected model doesn't support image input. Please change the model or remove images from the messages
tooltips.datasetRemoved: Your dataset has been removed. Select another one
tooltips.selectModel: Please select an LLM model for your prompt
tooltips.selectModels: Please select an LLM model for your prompts
tooltips.emptyMessages: Some messages are empty. Please add some text to proceed

prompts.title: Prompt library
prompts.deletePromptsConfirm: Deleting these prompts will also remove all associated commits. This action cannot be undone. Are you sure you want to continue?
prompts.deletePromptConfirm: Deleting a prompt will also remove all associated commits. This action can't be undone. Are you sure you want to continue?

explainers.whatsThePromptLibrary: Store and version prompts to maintain consistency and simplify experimentation across projects
explainers.howDoIWriteMyPrompt: Write prompts as your LLM would receive them, including any dynamic placeholders or formatting.
explainers.whatFormatShouldThePromptBe: Use mustache syntax to reference dataset variables in your prompt. Example: {{question}}.
explainers.whatFormatShouldTheMetadataBe: Use a valid JSON object with key-value pairs. Example: {"key": "value"}

feedback.title: Provide Feedback
feedback.message: Your feedback helps us improve Opik

errors.general: An error occurred. Please try again.
errors.notFound: The requested resource was not found.
errors.unauthorized: You are not authorized to access this resource.
errors.networkError: Network error. Please check your connection.
errors.validationError: Please check your input and try again.
